entries.femaleVariant: Heyo, Night City! Haha! I'm Josh Kavorkin, and Your Business is My Business!
Huuuge news from Toyko today! The "Nippon Daily News" has revealed a secret Arasaka project called "Relic."
Rumors had been swirling for a while about some sort of groundbreaking new tech, but even the biggest names in stocks had no clue what was coming.
According to reporters from "Nippon Daily News," the Relic is a biochip onto which you can transfer someone's... well, what, uh... Consciousness? Mind? Soul?
This chip contains a person's neural engram, as it's technically called, which you then connect to your own interface and... voilà! Now your brain has company.
Can you imagine?! Your mom dies at Christmas dinner, you pop her engram back in your head, and you pick your conversation right up where you left off.

But, but, but, but... Don't reach for those wallets yet. In an official statement, Arasaka has said the "Relic" won't yet go on sale in the "forseeable future," and is likely to be limited to an "exclusive client pool."
Sounds like us scopsucking peasants will have to settle buying Arasaka shares. Did you hear me? BUY, BUY, BUY! This announcement could take the roof off!
That's it for now, Night City! And remember – you've got what it takes to earn those eddies!
